name: Playa Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Playa Maya for a week in June in a superior ocean view room on the 3rd floor. It is a great little hotel, the staff are very courteous and helpful. The rooms are lovely, basic but kept incredibly clean with a fridge for your beer, flatscreen tv for when its raining (only rained for one day!) and good aircon. The balcony was fantastic to sit out on in the evening and watch the sea, definitely worth paying extra for an unobstructed ocean view. I loved the fact that you could only reach the hotel via the beach, it makes it very quiet in the evenings, especially considering you are only 2 minutes off the main street of playa. Breakfast on the beach was wonderful and they do great lunch food too. The hotel wasn't full when we stayed which we liked as it made the beach in front of the hotel more peaceful. Plenty of staff on the beachfront so felt safe and easy to get frozen margaritas. Playa del carmen itself is a lovely resort, perfect location to take trips to the mayan ruins (go to the ruins at Coba, fantastic!) and to go snorkelling and diving in the reef and caves. I can imagine that Playa del Carmen gets very busy at peak season and we were surprised by the prices in some of the restaurants, you do get much better deals if you venture off 5th avenue, I would highly recommend Oasis for awesome seafood at very good prices. 100% natural is also a great restaurant for us veggies!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were married in July in Cozumel, which we have been to many times and love. After the guests left, we wanted a change of scenery so decided to stay in Playa del Carmen. We found Playa Maya through Fodor's travel website and were not disapointed! The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and clean, and the free continental breakfast was great! Their swimming pool, though it is small, is definitely a bonus (many small beach hotels don't have them). I definitely reccomend Playa Maya to anyone looking for a small, charming boutique hotel located on the beach.
reviews.title: We had a fabulous honeymoon at Playa Maya!

reviews.text: We stayed in the family deluxe rooms. They are large rooms with a refrigerator and safe. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. Excellent location for either the beach, the ferry to Cozumel and all the activities on 5th street. For those renting a car, a self park 24 hour lot is on 10th street near fourth at a cost of 10 US dollars per 24 hours. Very reasonable and there were no problems leaving it. Another one is close by at 15 US dollars but you do not park it yourself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that I can add to all the great comments is that this hotel really is all the great things that others have already said. If you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel on the beach that offers excellent service you need not look any further. From the enjoyable breakfast on the beach to the relaxing massages while listening to the ocean waves, this place is simply great!! Playa is growing quickly and I hope that this little oasis isn't swallowed up by the big resorts moving in. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed Playa Maya and hope to return to our Playa "home" in the near future!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The months leading up to our vacation to Playa del Carmen had not been good ones so what we needed and wanted was to just relax. You never really know what to expect when going to a hotel that you’ve never been to before, Playa Maya was more then we could have hoped for. The pictures on their web site while being true can’t show the cleanliness or warmth of the room. For the record we never saw any bugs as indicated by other reviewers. Most vacations we don’t spend allot time in my room but this trip we did. The room (302) was large and comfortable with a full balcony. A/c worked great too. We also spent allot of time just laying out at the beach in front of the hotel and eating a majority of our lunches at their restaurant. Everything we had out of their kitchen was great. The staff is wonderful. They go out of their way to fulfill all requests and they do it with a smile. Leaving this little haven in paradise was difficult. I know we will be back.
reviews.title: Playa Maya was exactly what we needed

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend Playa Maya hotel. The hotel is clean, charming and the location can not be beat. The staff at Playa Maya goes out of their way to make it an enjoyable stay. The little things really add up at here, free bottled water each day, beach towels, chairs on the beach, free breakfast, complementary drinks upon arrival, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We were very pleased with the location, as it's really right on the beach. It was convenient to walk around town and be steps from the beach. Staff were really friendly and the food was good. I booked this hotel mostly based on prior reviews and the value. In the future, I'd probably prefer to stay in a more updated room or hotel. I do recall some bugs or ants in the bathroom and near the bed, but that may have been because you're so close to the beach and the windows are open. If you go further away from the main tourist strip, the prices of the local restaurants are so much more reasonable!
reviews.title: Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Playa Maya for a week and we loved it! The location right on the beach can't be beat, and certainly not for the price. The hotel is lovely, the rooms charming, spacious and immaculately maintained. And the hotel staff could not be friendlier or more willing to go out of their way to be helpful. Enjoying a good breakfast on the beach is a delightful way to start the day. We'll be back.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed at Playa Maya with our two kids in May and had a wonderful experience. I chose this hotel because of the rating here and also because it had some rooms that adjoined. This was great because my boys (ages 11 & 13) each had a double bed to themself and my hubby and I could have privacy. We loved the fact that they had a pool which doesn't seem too common for a smaller beachfront hotel. The restaurant was very good and every day other people would start up conversation with us and were so friendly. The staff here bend over backwards for you and for the price Playa Maya can't be beat! We plan on returning in the spring of 2009. Yay!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel!

aka: Playa Maya Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: Playa Maya, a boutique hotel opened in mid-2002, is located right on the beach in Playa del Carmen and just a block from 5th Avenue, the heart of activity here. Secluded location makes it a very tranquil property, providing the perfect base for exploring the nightlife of Playa and the wonders of the Mexican Caribbean, including a wealth of scuba diving, snorkeling and fishing activities, archaeological ruins of the ancient Maya at Tulum, Coba and Chichen Itza, the eco-parks Tres Rios, Xcaret and Xel-Ha, and Cozumel island and the facilities and attractions of Cancun, under an hour away by ferry and by car, respectively.
